meanings.definition: A type of hat worn in the Middle East.
meanings.sent1: In the market, colorful tarbushes caught the eye of the tourists.
meanings.sent2: The men at the festival proudly wore their traditional tarbushes.
meanings.sent3: During the play, the actors comically juggled tarbushes on their heads.
meanings.sent4: The sea of tarbushes in the crowd made it hard to spot his friends.
meanings.sent5: The tarbushes in the shop window gleamed under the bright sun.

meanings.definition: Plural form of tarbush, referring to multiple hats worn in the Middle East.
meanings.sent1: The market displayed a variety of tarbushes, from simple to ornate.
meanings.sent2: At the ceremony, the dignitaries donned their elegant tarbushes.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they played dress-up with the pile of tarbushes.
meanings.sent4: The skyline was dotted with tarbushes of different colors, like a vibrant mosaic.
meanings.sent5: The wind playfully tugged at the tassels of the tarbushes, creating a whimsical dance.
